definition: to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

sentences.english: Shows how to open a port and communicate wih other computers.
sentences.chinese: 這個程序演示了打開一個端口，並和其它計算機通信。

sentences.english: They opened the door and the four men alighted .
sentences.chinese: 他們打開車門，四個人都走了出來。

sentences.english: She get left her key in the office or get to toce the gate open.
sentences.chinese: 她把鑰匙忘在了辦公室，只好強行把門打開。

sentences.english: Steve uncorked bottles of champagne to toast the achievement.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫打開幾瓶香檳酒慶功。

sentences.english: Thee fopen function opens a specified file.
sentences.chinese: fopen函數打開一個指定的文件。

sentences.english: Open doors can provide enough draft so that a fire can run wild.
sentences.chinese: 打開門會提供足夠的氣流更會使火勢蔓延。

sentences.english: Opening the door in an emergency will automatically  inflate the evacuation slides.
sentences.chinese: 打開緊急出口的門會自動充氣逃離滑梯。

sentences.english: On a rainy day, Mayor Bloomberg opened the show with these words.
sentences.chinese: 圈”，市長布隆伯格打開這些話的節目。

sentences.english: This was key to managing the investors and opening more pockets of finance.
sentences.chinese: 這就是管理投資者和打開更多金主腰包的關鍵。

sentences.english: Will Microsoft open testing sign-ups again when RC1 is released?
sentences.chinese: 微軟是否會再RC1發佈時打開測試註冊嗎？

sentences.english: Still, the results are encouraging, opening a new pathway of study.
sentences.chinese: 無論如何，結果還是喜人的，並打開一條研究的新路。

sentences.english: Step 6: If you cannot open the doors, look for an emergency exit window.
sentences.chinese: 如果無法打開緊急車門，則尋找太平門窗戶。

sentences.english: She unwrapped the parcel, and took out the mirror it con-tained.
sentences.chinese: 她打開包袱，從裏面拿出鏡子。

sentences.english: He opened the bag and found some dollars and a passport in it.
sentences.chinese: 他打開提包發現裏面有一些美元和一份護照。

sentences.english: This, I believe, is the key to living a happy life.
sentences.chinese: 這，就是我所堅信的，打開生活中快樂之門的鑰匙。

sentences.english: You are a bit  scatty so you don't check names on payslips before opening them.
sentences.chinese: 你有點笨，所以纔沒覈實工資單上的名字就打開看。

definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
